description:
Brief Summary
Explore a platform that uses Jupyter to enable system administrators and operators to interact with the system and use this infrastructure to manage and analyze large HPC systems through a simple yet powerful interface.

Outline
In this talk we will explore the use of Jupyter as a platform for system administrators and operators to help manage, triage and gain insight into HPC systems. We will explains how the Jupyter framework lends itself to managing systems and makes notebooks a good choice for scheduling tasks and system analysis. We will share how HPE is proposing to use this infrastructure to manage its next generation of exascale systems.

Jupyter provides a unique environment to enable these use cases and workflows. It allows for interactive sessions as well as analysis, while allowing other users to review and collaborate on tasks. We will explore the new JupyterLab interface, which offers all the familiarity of the classic Jupyter Notebook with a next-generation UI, providing the flexibility, power, and extensibility needed to support the rich user experience for users’ workflows.
title: Exascale system management using Jupyter notebooks
